story:
Welcome to my fundraising campaign for my book “Quietus”

My name is Joseph Paul Gerges. Over the last 6 years I have been working on a body of work that I feel exemplifies printmaking at its best. One of the goals of this book is to introduce the art-form to a wider audience and share some of the processes, techniques, and methods I’ve implemented along the way. I’ll be presenting a rare behind-the-scenes look at the drawings, paintings, and printed proofs that have led to the final pieces showcased in the book. Also included in “Quietus” are elegantly photographed details of my creative practice. These images exemplify the craftsmanship and nuanced marks that goes into each and every one of my images helping to educate and inform readers about what goes into executing one of my intricate prints.

But this book is much more than a book about printmaking. The autobiographical writings included in “Quietus” weave together personal experiences with my creative process uncovering the complex emotional journey revealed in my work. As we encounter hardships in our lives, I believe that these moments serve to inform and enlighten us. Our pains and misfortunes have the ability to uncover pivotal moments of illumination and growth. “Quietus” is a tool for granting permission, allowing our adversities and blemishes to become the celebrated marker of our diverse individuality and shared humanity. My hope is that through my vulnerability, that the art and book will serve as a mirror, reflecting the innermost beauty and divinity of the human spirit, propelling us forward as our highest selves.

“Quietus” will be a hard-bound coffee table style art book measuring 11.25” x 11.25” square with more than 150 pages of content. Each book sold through this fundraiser will contain a specially designed bookplate, individually signed and numbered, as a thank you gift to the patrons of this campaign. Funds raised for this project will go toward the cost of designing, printing, and publishing the highest quality art catalog with the utmost attention paid to the craftsmanship of this multi-year effort. 

This fundraiser is also the VERY FIRST TIME I will sell a selection of my ORIGINAL PRINTS before they are exhibited! I feel that in giving the supporters of my work the very first opportunity to own an original work of art, I am also showing gratitude to those that have come to know and support the artwork that will be gracing the pages of this beautiful hardbound book. I look forward to sharing "Quietus" with you all. Please feel free to share and pass along this campaign using Indiegogo's share tools and thank you all for your support!

As we meet and hopefully surpass our goals, I’ll be adding special surprises that will be announced along the way so please check back from time to time.

Help me make this book a reality. Please join me with your pledge of support today!

 

REWARDS & PERKS!

Every print that is a part of my final edition is hand debossed with my custom "Buck" chop. This stamp is a one of a kind sculpted brass medallion hand pressed into each finalized intaglio print.

 

The images below reflect a selection of a few of the perks on the right side of your screen. Click the box on the "PERKS" section for a detailed description of what you are getting with the aligned perk.

REQUIEM

Printed on Sirio Ultra Black Paper 280gsm in 14 colors with a metallic glitter ink highlighting the flowers. Paper size of 25” x 25”.

Edition of 45

 

HALFSLEEP​

Created using hard ground etching, aquatint & drypoint on copper. Paper size – 12.5” x 15” | Image size – 3.75" x 5" - Printed in 2016 

Edition of 20

 

DAUGHTERS​

Created using hard ground etching and drypoint.This print is printed with chin-colle’ (toned rice paper printed on a backing paper). This edition is labeled EV (edition varied) due to slight variations in paper color. Printed in 2018. Paper size- 11.25” x 15” | Image size – 5.25" x 8"

Edition of 12

 

REPOSE​

Printed on Sirio Ultra Black Paper 280gsm in 9 colors with a metallic gold leaves and a gloss coat over the Fawn for contrast. Paper size of 25" x 35"

Edition of 100

 

QUIET

Created using hard ground etching, aquatint & drypoint on copper. Paper size – 17” x 22.5” | Image size – 6" x 9" - Printed in 2016

Edition of 18

 
FAMILIAL

Created using hard ground etching, aquatint & drypoint on 2 copper plates. Printed in 2018. Paper size- 22.5” x 29.75” | Image size – 17.5" x 23.5"

Edition of 20

 

FAMILIAL

Created using hard ground etching, aquatint & drypoint on 2 copper plates. Printed with Chin Colle’ (toned rice paper printed on a backing paper)in 2018. Paper size- 22.5” x 29.75” | Image size – 17.5" x 23.5"

Edition of 10

story:
Please visit our current campaign at:

http://igg.me/p/319117/x/29265

Our objective is two fold;

1. Raise enough funds to help Agustin with living expenses by purchasing the helicopter and his home. He will retain both and at the end of his life the helicopter will be preserved to be a lasting legacy of who Agustin is and how he spent his life.

2. We would also like to raise enough to try and get Agustin up in a helicopter.

All of this will be filmed to make a feature length film about this amazing man.

 

“Even though I live in a house full of water, I have been grateful fighting for it (the helicopter).”
~ Agustin, "The Helicopter Man"

Background:

"Everything is Incredible"

Beginning in 2007 Producer-Directors Tyler Bastian, Trevor Hill and Tim Skousen embarked on a journey to make a film that tells a story of a man Tyler met in Honduras over a decade ago. "Everything is Incredible" is about Agustin, who is physically disabled from polio, yet has spent 50 years building a surprisingly advanced helicopter out of re-bar, bicycle parts and wood. His dream to take flight has inspired us to capture his spirit, attitude, and perspective in an emotional film about determination and the purpose of life goals.

http://theriseinstitute.com/...
http://vimeo.com/2315077

The film has an original score by Kirby Heyborne and Tyler Hill.

story:
My name's Nate, I'm a trans guy from the UK. I've been with the NHS Gender Identity Clinic since March 2017 and after over 2 years of waiting,  I've decided to ask for some help. I can't see the waiting times for NHS funded top-surgery getting any shorter and I thought with a little support from generous people around the world, I could get myself a little closer to being content with my body. 

Being transgender isn’t something I let rule my life. However, certain activities that remind me of the insecurities I have about my body can really effect my mental health. As someone who has suffered quite badly with an eating disorder, I have never had a great relationship with how I look. After realising that the disorder was directly linked to gender dysphoria, I started a proper physical recovery by wanting to have a more muscular, masculine appearance. Even before starting testosterone, my relationship with food got better, I had the initiative to be healthy, start working out for muscle gain instead of weight loss and I became much more confident in my body. Going to the gym for the past 2 years has helped me so much, although I do have some restrictions and anxieties when I go. Binders shouldn't be worn when exercising, open changing rooms are never fun, I can't go swimming anymore. Along with a lot of other things, this puts me in rather upsetting situations. 

I can't see the waiting times for NHS funded top-surgery getting any shorter and I thought with a little support from generous people around the world, I could get myself a little closer to contention with my body. 

Every little helps, so thank you for anything you can scrape towards my campaign!

story:
In 2018, a BEquinox Art Grant was applied for...and granted! However, terrible weather conditions in San Diego county, south of the Joshua Tree event, kept the Dionysus crew from getting the art car to BEquinox. The hillside where the trailered art car was stored was not accessible, as it had become a large, muddy slip-n-slide. Dionysus never made it to BEquinox, therefore the grant money was not realized. 

The art grant was $829, which was great! However more than $1500 was spent, on things like new flooring, tires for the art car and it's trailer, new shocks, etc. Huge fun comes at a cost! But this campaign is only seeking to recoup the original art grant amount of $829. 

A contribution of even $5 or $10 will help us reach the goal! However, if you're not able to contribute, we understand and would LOVE YOU if you spread the word on this campaign to your Burner friends.

story:
Hello everyone!

We are Elysa and Maria, Miami based artists who collaborate as the BABA Collective. Over the past 2 years we have been interviewing South Florida based artists and creatives for our Rocking Chair Sessions podcast. We talk about art, money, education, politics and other themes that make our lives interesting. As an archive we are able to provide an intimate encounter with local artists and creatives that lets you see beyond what is usually available on the internet.

The idea of the BABA COLLECTIVE was born when in discussion of the diversity of artists that were found at the Bakehouse Art Complex, the artist residency where we met, and other institutions in Miami. RCS: ROCKING CHAIRS SESSIONS was created to serve as a publicly accessible forum where one could find individual recordings describing the professions, media, and life of South Florida based creatives.

Rocking Chair Sessions Exhibit

This campaign will support the second Rocking Chair Sessions exhibition celebrating 50 artists and creatives we have interviewed for our podcast. It will take place in Miami, FL with an opening reception scheduled for May 2019. As Baba Collective we want to build bridges via South Florida’s oral history and creative practices that range from sculpture, to video, painting, performance, photography, curating, and bookmaking.

Your support will make this exhibition possible!!

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising money to match a Community grant we were awarded from the Miami Dade Departement of Cultural Affairs to cover the cost for the Rocking Chair Sessions exhibition. We are so humbled that they believe in our project and want to make sure that we do our part in fundraising. There are some wonderful perks you can choose from. We hand silk screened our Rocking Chair Sessions Tote bags that we are happily shipping your way and there are also brand new Rocking Chair Sessions mugs you can choose from. 

The Impact

The South Florida art community has been growing over the last decades and is now a vital part of the national and global art scene (and not just during Art Basel anymore). We love all the folks that work so hard to make this happen and want to give them a platform to talk about their experiences and also show us their artwork. We are so excited to put another great exhibition together that celebrates the South Florida art community and also to let people know about the wonderful stories we were able to capture on the Rocking Chair Sessions podcast.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this project with friends, family, and your social networks!  We cannot express how helpful this is. You can listen to our podcast on Soundcloud and iTunes. Check out our website and instagram account. Help us spread the word! #ittakesavillage

story:
LET THE RECORD SHOW is a public art project created by artist Matt Allyn Chapman with the help of fellow artists Caitlin Downs, and Matthew Kabik. In collaboration with Lancaster Public Art, and funded in part by the Pennsylvania Council on the Arts the project is a direct response to The Lancaster Sound Map. The LSM is a multi-faceted project revealing the diverse character of Lancaster, Pennsylvania. Created by artist Stuart Hyatt, the LSM is intended to be a growing platform of free-use content, from which many creative projects may arise.

Looking at the roots of where Hyatt started his project, we plan to expand on them through a variety of artistic mediums. Over the course of a year, Stuart gathered audio recordings from all around Lancaster County. Along with the FIELDWORKS group of musicians he condensed the recordings into nine original audio tracks. These recordings were collected and made into a vinyl record titled BORN IN THE EAR. 

Using the vinyl record, its packaging, and it’s circular shape as a point of departure, our project will bring together visual art, the written word, and audio documentation. Chapman is to make a series of nine pieces based on walks that he, Kabik, and Downs embark on from nine locations in Lancaster County. Each piece will be created within a circular boarder, exactly the same circumference as a vinyl record. Each walk will be tracked and recorded using GPS, as if they were the drawing tool and the landscape is their paper. The resulting “walk line” will then be incorporated into each of his nine pieces. The content of each will vary based on the experience of the walk and the observations He makes. 

As the record contained a written piece to accompany each track, Chapman's works will be accompanied by a collection of corresponding short stories. Four written by Matthew Kabik, four written by Caitlin Downs, and the 9th will be a collaborative effort between all three artists. Kabik will also be conducting an audio recording of the excursions and capture the genuine nature of the conversations, along with all atmospheric and residual noises. He will then accumulate these into “episodes” that can be accessed and listened to during the project as well as after it’s completion. Creating in a sense, a sound map of our own.

The final project will culminate into printed and signed editions of the artworks and writings. Each edition will be housed in a heavyweight gatefold album jacket, mimicking a vinyl record. Inside each jacket will hold a series of nine individual prints, one for each of the nine circular pieces created by Chapman. Also contained in the jacket will be the collected short stories written by Downs and Kabik . These collections will be produced in a small run of 100 editions, 50 being available during this campaign, 40 will be made available during a project reception held in Lancaster city, and 10 will be donated to Lancaster Public Art. The original drawings along with their respective short story will be displayed at the Lancaster City Amtrak Station.

We have been awarded an artist stipend of $600, as part of Lancaster Public Art’s ongoing efforts to encourage new work, created in response to the Lancaster Sound Map. Funding for this stipend came from a Project Stream Grant awarded to Lancaster Public Art by PCA.

The amount in this campaign will be used towards the creation of original artworks and short stories. With two thirds of the goal going to the businesses utilized in supplying project materials, and creation of the collected print editions. The final third of our goal going to the artists themselves for their skills and expertise in bringing this vision into reality.

Through our thoughtfully crafted (and in some cases one of a kind) perks we have an array of exciting  offerings! From a much appreciated thank you credit, beautifully constructed limited edition Zines, the well loved sketchbooks and draftbooks used for each walk, to the original artworks themselves. There is something here that will surely get you exited and help you to feel like you were out there with us.

Know that no matter the outcome of the campaign, your donation will be used to realize this teams vision. 

This project is more than just walking and looking, it’s about moving outside of our familiar spaces and entering new ones. Spaces which hold new experiences that the landscape and environment have cultivated. Some can be revisited time and time again, and others that can only exist in the present. To walk is to make a contact unlike any other. It’s not so much about transportation, but connection to the physicality of place, and to the people who built it, and continue to live in it. 

The residents and communities of Lancaster County and those beyond have an opportunity to see how unique we all are, while finding common threads that bind us all at the same time. Ultimately bringing these works to the Lancaster Amtrak station will give visitors and commuters alike a glimpse into just how vibrant Lancaster is, not just in it’s arts, but in the wholeness that makes this county what it is today.

The overall nature of ideas tend to be free of pitfalls and setbacks, it isn’t until we really begin to bring these ideas to life that the obstacles make themselves known. The bigger the idea, the bigger the obstacles seem to be. Though this project will have it’s challenges, they only add to the legitimacy and the accomplishment that will be present at it’s completion.

Executing the walks, building the conversations, and bringing this information into a cohesive collection that spans multiple visual and audio formats will be one of the largest challenges. Then comes the actual production of the physical collection, with so many facets that in some cases wont be truly realized until we are well into the project, the risks will be around every turn.

Matt Chapman will assume creative lead and Matthew Kabik & Caitlin Downs will provide integral partnership and technical knowledge needed for successful completion of the project. We are established creative professionals and possess proven leadership skills and project completion in our respective fields. With the support of the Pennsylvania Council on the Arts paired with our own growing and varied network of interested community members in our corner, we will bring these networks into one to forge an even stronger relationship. Respecting each others opinions, building on each others strengths, not forgetting to have a good time, and to simply enjoy the walk will ensure the success of this project.

People can do many amazing things on their own, but behind so many great moments in art and in life, it’s the collective voice which speaks the loudest. We call on you to share this project with those in your circles and encourage them to do that same. Use the sharing tools provided on this page and let us know your walking along with us!

It’s not so much about transportation, but connection to the physicality of place, and to the people who built it, and continue to live in it. The residents and communities of Lancaster County and those beyond have an opportunity to see how unique we all are, while finding common threads that bind us all at the same time. Ultimately bringing these works to the Lancaster Amtrak station will give visitors and commuters alike a glimpse into just how vibrant Lancaster is, not just in it’s arts, but in the wholeness that makes this county what it is today.The overall nature of ideas tend to be free of pitfalls and setbacks, it isn’t until we really begin to bring these ideas to life that the obstacles make themselves known. The bigger the idea, the bigger the obstacles seem to be. Though this project will have it’s challenges, they only add to the legitimacy and the accomplishment that will be present at it’s completion.Executing the walks, building the conversations, and bringing this information into a cohesive collection that spans multiple visual and audio formats will be one of the largest challenges. Then comes the actual production of the physical collection, with so many facets that in some cases wont be truly realized until we are well into the project, the risks will be around every turn.Matt Chapman will assume creative lead and Matthew Kabik & Caitlin Downs will provide integral partnership and technical knowledge needed for successful completion of the project. We are established creative professionals and possess proven leadership skills and project completion in our respective fields. With the support of the Pennsylvania Council on the Arts paired with our own growing and varied network of interested community members in our corner, we will bring these networks into one to forge an even stronger relationship. Respecting each others opinions, building on each others strengths, not forgetting to have a good time, and to simply enjoy the walk will ensure the success of this project.People can do many amazing things on their own, but behind so many great moments in art and in life, it’s the collective voice which speaks the loudest. We call on you to share this project with those in your circles and encourage them to do that same. Use the sharing tools provided on this page and let us know your walking along with us!

story:
Project summary


"a love story" is a long-format poem in picture book form. 
written and illustrated by benjamin lee hicks

benjamin lee hicks is a visual artist, elementary school teacher and graduate student. They taught junior kindergarten - grade 6 classrooms in the Toronto District School Board for 8 years prior to beginning graduate work in Curriculum Studies and Teacher Development at the Ontario Institute for Studies in Education, University of Toronto. benjamin has written and designed curriculum materials for elementary schools on topics of sustainable community building, all-gender inclusion and arts-based activism. They are interested in how we might better support teachers to expect queerness and prepare for multi-dimensional gender identity in elementary school classrooms. benjamin’s current research focuses on how faculties of education can teach pre-service teacher candidates to learn about queer identities with direct permission and support to discuss their own feelings, fears and reservations about this topic. They are interested in slowing down the pace at which social justice education is addressed in early teacher training; making room for heart-based processing alongside social and political theory.  

email: benjaminlee.hicks@mail.utoronto.ca    website: www.leehicks.weebly.com

The funds generated from this campaign will assist with the up-front costs of self-publishing, and many of the incentives include one (or several) copies of the completed, 46 page book.

THE STORY of A LOVE STORY:
I wrote the text portion of this book for my grade 2, 3 and 4 students almost 3 years ago. It began as my attempt to have deeper conversations about what the lived experience of BE-ing a presence of empathy, caring and kindness in the world might FEEL like... How this might feel differently to each of us based on our own experiences... how we could talk, draw, write about these ideas, and how they might play out in our lives together. These were conversations that I was privileged to continue with the same students over the next two years as I completed the illustrations (and eventually the layout) for this book. This short-run, self-published version represents the story's first few steps into the wider world, and I would love for it to continue to  be shared.

Here is an excerpt from the book/poem to peak your interest:

Our thoughts combined with our actions are power-full.
In the full-ness : potential.
Potential energy to fuel our thoughts and our actions;
Potential of intent and for individual choice. 
 
We can choose ways of thinking and being that will others good-ness,
or those that intend them harm.
We can dedicate our BE-ing to the creation of greater LOVE in the world,
or to actions that create hate.
This potential is in all of us,
and it does not go away by pretending that it is not there.

Ignoring this power (intentional ignor-ance) creates apathy.
Apathy is a calculated lack of caring,
and that is also a choice.

EVEN WHEN IT IS HARD,
we have a choice.
ESPECIALLY when it is hard,
we have a responsibility;
A responsibility to be aware of the kind of energy 
that we put out into the world with every choice.

MORE THAN ANYTHING ELSE 
WE WANT TO LOVE AND BE LOVED…
more than ANYTHING else.

But we are also human,
and we are also flawed,
and sometimes we go about it all from the long and backwards way around.

Please see the video posted on this site for further teasers, and/or visit my website at  --  http://leehicks.weebly.com/a-love-story-book-pr...  to read and see more.

 

What is needed and what comes out of it:

HERE'S WHAT THE $800 COVERS:

  • professional printing costs for 25 x soft-cover, 46-page, "perfect-bound" books
  • supplies for incentive patches, posters and t-shirts
  • customs and shipping costs from the U.S printing people to me
  • shipping costs from me to you
  • this amount allows me to break even once folks have ordered approximately 18 books 

POTENTIAL PROFITS AND USES:

  • this is not a big money-maker, nor is it intended to be
  • more than anything, i'd just really like to make more of these books BUT the printing costs are prohibitive when it comes to ordering-before-selling
  • if all goes well, i will eventually make approximately $300 in profit  (if/when i sell all 25 books)
  • any profit will go towards travel costs to attend conferences and workshops that are helping me along the way with my graduate studies and research in Curriculum Studies and Teacher Development
  • For example, in May, i will be heading to the Sequential Artists Workshop (SAW) in Gainesville, Florida.  i am grateful and excited to have the opportunity to be working with some amazing teachers and learning more about how to turn one chapter of my Masters Thesis in Curriculum Studies and Teacher Development into a kick-ass graphic story.

HERE'S WHAT YOU CAN GET!...

  • any contribution of $45 CAD or greater guarantees you one of the 25 limited-edition copies of "a love story" that i am planning to print.
  • there are a variety of incentives and options available to you for multiple books + other cool things if you are wanting and able to contribute more!
  • if you'd like to contribute to the project in an amount lower than $55 CAD, a) THANK YOU! and b) there are several fun incentive combos for you to choose from which include hand-made patches, poster-sized versions of book pages, and original, silk screened t-shirts.

TO DATE:

I have already sold more than 40 copies of this book by other means, and the response has been overwhelmingly positive. I have had several requests to produce more - it is just a question of HOW at this point... hence: this crowd-funding experiment. 

*REGARDLESS OF WHETHER I MEET MY MONETARY GOAL OR NOT, everyone who orders a book will get one (it will be a whole heck of a lot easier with funding... but just so you know that your investment is safe either way!)

Are you in?...

 

​Other ways you can help:

  • If financial support and the purchasing of things is not an option for you right now but you'd still like to help, please consider sharing my campaign with your people!
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign simply and easily, and/or whatever other means that you feel comfortable with.

 

THANK YOU so much for reading, considering, supporting and/or sharing.

 - benjamin

story:
Hello everyone,

My name is kyung moon from south korea.
I love drawing and one of my dreams is having my own art product brand.

If you support me that will help me a lot !! Please see my illust video and blog. If you like it, please support me and my art. I will never forget one of you all.

Thank you very much.

 

"Lemonluna" Artist statement :

I believe i can change the world in a good way through my art and good energy. I hope my brighten energy bring good luck to everyone's daily life.

I believe if i give good energy to someone probably he will give good energy as well to who arounds with him. We influence each other in our lives. I think in this way, slowly but surely we can make the world a better place : )

story:
Short Summary

www.facebook.com/thenewfamilymovie

In this slasher/thriller set in 1987, a killer preys upon pregnant women in the sleepy town of Murdoch.

Blair Cassidy is beautiful and bored. The sleepy town of Murdoch offers nothing new to her, until the body of a young woman is found in the park. Two days later another body is found near the shores of Hollow's Lake, both women discovered in compromising positions. Now the boring town of Murdoch has become a town of terror. When authorities release a connection to the victims, Blair is impregnated with sudden panic. Like her, the two women were with child. A killer stalks the streets, with a motive more terrifying than Blair or any woman could ever imagine.

What We Need & What You Get

 

Click in images to see some of Marc's fantastic designs!

 

We need $500 to hire artist Marc Schoenbach to design our official poster.  These will be distributed nationwide, beginning at The Hot Springs Horror Film Festival this September, hosted by HALLOWEEN 5 star Tamara Glynn!

For your donation, you will receive the prizes listed above, including a SIGNED COPY of THE NEW FAMILY poster designed by Marc Schoenbach!  Marc is a horror artist, featured in famed horror magaizine, FANGORIA.  You will also receive AN ON SCREEN CREDIT in the film, which shoots in 2014!

 

 Don't have money to donate?  That's okay, you can still help!  Spread the word and share this page to as many people as possible!  Every dollar counts, and we cannot do this without your support!

 

Below are some examples of Marc Schoenbach's work. Pledge today to have him create the official poster for The New Family.

story:
Thanks for checking our campaign. We are in the midst of establishing Europe's first Gallery for showcasing contemporary photography from Australia and New Zealand in Berlin and throughout Europe.

The gallery will act as a window to emerging photography from Australia and New Zealand for photography enthusiasts in Europe. As well as providing the opportunity for Australian and New Zealand Photographers to gain exposure in the European market. 

We have found a location for our gallery on Linienstrasse in Berlin Mitte, which is one of the more established 'gallery districts' in Berlin. Its proximity to other galleries and central location will ensure good exposure for the gallery and the photographers who show their work there. 


View Larger Map

  

Michael Dooney is an artist, architectural lighting designer and photography enthusiast from Perth, Western Australia. After working 10 years at an electrical consultancy firm in Perth, he relocated to Germany to complete a Master in Architectural Lighting Design. After a period in Hamburg he moved to Berlin where he has been working as a freelance lighting designer for a number of reputable Architects and Lighting Design offices.

For over ten years Michael has been actively involved in the cultural sector in both Perth and Berlin. During his time in Perth he was involved with the local music scene as both a musician, manager and promoter. His photography later provided him the opportunity to exhibit at the Perth Centre for Photography, with his first solo exhibition included in the FotoFreo 2008 Festival of Photography. 

As an expatriate Australian living in Europe he was witnessed first hand the increased competition artists face here as opposed to at home. With Galerie Pavlova he wishes to provide an opportunity for Australian and New Zealand contemporary photographers to gain exposure for their work outside the usual channels. 

 

  

Our first exhibition is planned for November and we are pleased to announce that we will be presenting the work of Melbourne based photographer Polixeni Papapetrou and her series Between Worlds.
Details of the opening will be sent closer to the date, however you can see more of her work on her website: http://www.polixenipapapetrou.net/


Anyone who has ever started their own business knows that there are many up front costs which need to be taken care of to ensure its long term success. After consulting with a business planner we have determined what our major and ongoing expenses are and written up a budget.

We are approaching the Investment Bank of Berlin to secure a start-up loan to help cover many of our initial costs. However to reduce this financial burden we are also reaching out to the crowd-funding community to help get this project off the ground and guarantee its first year of operation. 

In addition to the ongoing costs, such as renting the gallery and shipping of art works from Australia & New Zealand to Germany, we also have to allow for the following:

  • Upgrade the Lighting (ca. 3000€ to 4000€)
  • Furnishing the Gallery (ca. 1000€ to 2000€)
  • Signage
  • Business Registration
  • Promotional and Marketing Material (ca. 1000€)
  • Advertising the first exhibitions

With a budget of €5000 we hope to upgrade the lighting to the gallery space to best present the art work. We have met with a local (Berlin based) luminaire manufacturer to develop the best solution for the space within the small budget. LED will not be possible at this stage, however we have designed a system which can be upgraded at a later date. 

  

Any funds remaining from the crowd funding will be put towards essential furniture and promoting the first exhibition. However it is envisaged that the majority of the crowd funding will go towards the lighting system.

One of our goals for the first year of operation is to take part in the European Month of Photography, which is hosted in Berlin every two years. Participation in this event will provide great exposure for our photographers and give Galerie Pavlova international recognition. In addition to the European Month of Photography, we will also be applying to the Unseen Photofair in Amsterdam, which promotes not only emerging photography but also emerging collectors.

                 

The location of the gallery will also allow it to receive exposure during the other art fairs in Berlin which take place throughout the year such as:

  • Gallery Weekend Berlin 
  • Browse FotoFestival 
  • Berlin Art Week
  • Art Berlin Contemporary


                 


We want to organise workshops and assist artists from Australia and New Zealand to make the trip over here so they can personally promote their work and connect with the audience in Berlin.

In the future we also hope to organise an exchange between photographers from Germany, Australia and New Zealand - whereby photographers from each region would travel to the other photographers respective locations to produce work and an eventual exhibition. The idea being to further explore the cultural exchange possibilities of the gallery and the interaction between the artists and the public.  

In addition to being part of establishing the first contemporary photography gallery dedicated to Australian and New Zealand photography, located in the heart of Berlin:

No matter where you are in the world (meaning that postage is included) all contributions over 10€ will receive a hand written postcard personally thanking them for their support. Which works out to be less than 1€ per month over the year, not a bad deal to be one of the early adopters!

Do you like to collect postcards from all the exhibitions that you visit? Wish that you were able to pick up one for each of our shows? The 49€ postcard subscription is just that, so for each exhibition that we have throughout the year (6 planned), you will receive a copy in the mail. As well as the hand written thankyou postcard thanking you for your support.

Membership to Galerie Pavlova shows your true support for Australian and New Zealand contemporary photography. Membership is a standard price of 89€ for one year or 7,42€ per month or 1,72€ per week or 0,24€ per day, depending how you want to look at it.

In return we will place a link from our page to your website acknowledging your contribution and commitment to the promotion of Australian and New Zealand contemporary photography in Europe. This link will remain on the website indefinitely with a new list added each year for new members. 

Another special gift for members is the Official Galerie Pavlova hand made screen printed bag from FS Screen Printing. Each bag is individually made in Berlin my mahaila in her studio. Check her store on Etsy to see her other creations. 

 

All gallery memberships of course include the post card subscription as well as a hand written thank you card, acknowledging your support. 

Since 2011 I have been working on a project about the Volkspark Friedrichshain in Berlin, documenting my experience of the European landscape from my Australian foreign perspective. In particular the change in the seasons, which is much more visual and dramatic than what I am used to coming from Perth Western Australia. It will still be some months and possibly years before the series reaches its conclusion, however as part of the fund raising campaign for Galerie Pavlova I am offering for the first time limited edition prints from this body of work. 

This photo was taken on the 9th of November in 2012 on one of the rare sunny Autumn days, which presents the beautiful colours of the changing leaves against a clear blue sky. The low angle of the sun at this time of year has a different quality to that in summer, making it all the more special when it makes an appearance. 
I am offer the above image in a limited number of 10 images for the purpose of the campaign. The image will be a traditional c-print hand printed in the dark room where all of my film is developed in Berlin. The museum quality photo is printed on Fujicolor Crystal Archive Professional Paper, on of the few remaining traditional paper types still available. Paper size will be 40cm x 50cm, with the image being approximately 38cm x 38cm. Allowing it to be either cut to square and framed, or remain in a polaroid orientation. The photo can be delivered any where in the world, subject to additional shipping costs.

In addition to the aforementioned art print, I am also preparing a series of smaller ink-jet prints in the autumn theme. The above images were taking during 2011 and 2012 as part of the series and present another perspective of the seasonal change. 
These prints will only be available as part of the campaign and as a complete set of 9 individual images. Photos will be printed on Fujicolor Crystal Archive Paper for best colour reproduction and longevity. Paper size of 18cm x 24cm will final image size of approximately 16cm x 16cm - allowing for framing both in square format or polaroid style. The set of images can be delivered any where in the world, subject to additional shipping costs. 
All limited edition images will be individually signed and numbered. This offer is unique to the crowd funding campaign and will not be available any where else. 

As a special offer to help raise funds for the gallery, I will be offering lighting design consultations at a reduced cost of 79€ for a two hour session. This is aimed at artists, gallery owners, independent architectural practices and other people who would not normally be able to afford the services of a trained lighting designer.

In this time we can discuss any questions that you may have about lighting, such as the different luminaires and lamp types which are available; explain the different qualities of light such as colour rendering, colour temperature and its other properties. There is also the possibility to work through any lighting problems that may have been presented to you in your work. 

I am designing the lighting for the gallery so that the photography can be presented in the best light possible. Not only do we want to showcase the best in contemporary Australian and New Zealand photography, we also want to lead the way in small gallery boutique style lighting. 

   

For 59€ you can book a personal 1 on 1 portrait photography session, in which we would produce 3-5 images of your choice and delivered digitally at the resolution suitable for making 10x15cm reproductions. 

Primarily I work with medium format analogue (film) cameras, which although do not offer the immediacy of their digital counterparts, allow me to work in a more organic and thoughtful way. I prefer the natural look that comes with this technique and do minimal retouching, aiming to create an authentic portrait of the sitter. 

Although I am based in Berlin, I am often in Hamburg and I am able to travel to other parts of Germany. For those not in the area, if you wish you can purchase a portrait session in advance to fund the gallery and use it when you are next in this region.

    


Even if you are not able to contribute to our campaign, we would really appreciate you spreading the news of our gallery and fund raising campaign. You can keep up to date with our developments on our website and the usual social media avenues:

Official Website: http://www.galeriepavlova.com
Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/galeriepavlova
Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/galeriepavlova
We're also on Tumblr: http://galeriepavlova.tumblr.com/

        

Many thanks for your interest in this project and we hope to see you at our opening!

Any funds remaining from the crowd funding will be put towards essential furniture and promoting the first exhibition. However it is envisaged that the majority of the crowd funding will go towards the lighting system.

Participation in this event will provide great exposure for our photographers and give Galerie Pavlova international recognition. In addition to the European Month of Photography, we will also be applying to the Unseen Photofair in Amsterdam, which promotes not only emerging photography but also emerging collectors.

                 
The location of the gallery will also allow it to receive exposure during the other art fairs in Berlin which take place throughout the year such as:


Gallery Weekend Berlin 


Browse FotoFestival 

Berlin Art Week

Art Berlin Contemporary




                 



We want to organise workshops and assist artists from Australia and New Zealand to make the trip over here so they can personally promote their work and connect with the audience in Berlin.
In the future we also hope to organise an exchange between photographers from Germany, Australia and New Zealand - whereby photographers from each region would travel to the other photographers respective locations to produce work and an eventual exhibition. The idea being to further explore the cultural exchange possibilities of the gallery and the interaction between the artists and the public.  


In addition to being part of establishing the first contemporary photography gallery dedicated to Australian and New Zealand photography, located in the heart of Berlin:



No matter where you are in the world (meaning that postage is included) all contributions over 10€ will receive a hand written postcard personally thanking them for their support. Which works out to be less than 1€ per month over the year, not a bad deal to be one of the early adopters!

Do you like to collect postcards from all the exhibitions that you visit? Wish that you were able to pick up one for each of our shows? The 49€ postcard subscription is just that, so for each exhibition that we have throughout the year (6 planned), you will receive a copy in the mail. As well as the hand written thankyou postcard thanking you for your support.




Membership to Galerie Pavlova shows your true support for Australian and New Zealand contemporary photography. Membership is a standard price of 89€ for one year or 7,42€ per month or 1,72€ per week or 0,24€ per day, depending how you want to look at it.
In return we will place a link from our page to your website acknowledging your contribution and commitment to the promotion of Australian and New Zealand contemporary photography in Europe. This link will remain on the website indefinitely with a new list added each year for new members. 
Another special gift for members is the Official Galerie Pavlova hand made screen printed bag from FS Screen Printing. Each bag is individually made in Berlin my mahaila in her studio. Check her store on Etsy to see her other creations. 
 
All gallery memberships of course include the post card subscription as well as a hand written thank you card, acknowledging your support. 


Since 2011 I have been working on a project about the Volkspark Friedrichshain in Berlin, documenting my experience of the European landscape from my Australian foreign perspective. In particular the change in the seasons, which is much more visual and dramatic than what I am used to coming from Perth Western Australia. It will still be some months and possibly years before the series reaches its conclusion, however as part of the fund raising campaign for Galerie Pavlova I am offering for the first time limited edition prints from this body of work. 
This photo was taken on the 9th of November in 2012 on one of the rare sunny Autumn days, which presents the beautiful colours of the changing leaves against a clear blue sky. The low angle of the sun at this time of year has a different quality to that in summer, making it all the more special when it makes an appearance. 
I am offer the above image in a limited number of 10 images for the purpose of the campaign. The image will be a traditional c-print hand printed in the dark room where all of my film is developed in Berlin. The museum quality photo is printed on Fujicolor Crystal Archive Professional Paper, on of the few remaining traditional paper types still available. Paper size will be 40cm x 50cm, with the image being approximately 38cm x 38cm. Allowing it to be either cut to square and framed, or remain in a polaroid orientation. The photo can be delivered any where in the world, subject to additional shipping costs.



In addition to the aforementioned art print, I am also preparing a series of smaller ink-jet prints in the autumn theme. The above images were taking during 2011 and 2012 as part of the series and present another perspective of the seasonal change. 
These prints will only be available as part of the campaign and as a complete set of 9 individual images. Photos will be printed on Fujicolor Crystal Archive Paper for best colour reproduction and longevity. Paper size of 18cm x 24cm will final image size of approximately 16cm x 16cm - allowing for framing both in square format or polaroid style. The set of images can be delivered any where in the world, subject to additional shipping costs. 
All limited edition images will be individually signed and numbered. This offer is unique to the crowd funding campaign and will not be available any where else. 


As a special offer to help raise funds for the gallery, I will be offering lighting design consultations at a reduced cost of 79€ for a two hour session. This is aimed at artists, gallery owners, independent architectural practices and other people who would not normally be able to afford the services of a trained lighting designer.
In this time we can discuss any questions that you may have about lighting, such as the different luminaires and lamp types which are available; explain the different qualities of light such as colour rendering, colour temperature and its other properties. There is also the possibility to work through any lighting problems that may have been presented to you in your work. 
I am designing the lighting for the gallery so that the photography can be presented in the best light possible. Not only do we want to showcase the best in contemporary Australian and New Zealand photography, we also want to lead the way in small gallery boutique style lighting. 


   
For 59€ you can book a personal 1 on 1 portrait photography session, in which we would produce 3-5 images of your choice and delivered digitally at the resolution suitable for making 10x15cm reproductions. 
Primarily I work with medium format analogue (film) cameras, which although do not offer the immediacy of their digital counterparts, allow me to work in a more organic and thoughtful way. I prefer the natural look that comes with this technique and do minimal retouching, aiming to create an authentic portrait of the sitter. 
Although I am based in Berlin, I am often in Hamburg and I am able to travel to other parts of Germany. For those not in the area, if you wish you can purchase a portrait session in advance to fund the gallery and use it when you are next in this region.
    


Even if you are not able to contribute to our campaign, we would really appreciate you spreading the news of our gallery and fund raising campaign. You can keep up to date with our developments on our website and the usual social media avenues:
Official Website: http://www.galeriepavlova.comFollow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/galeriepavlovaLike us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/galeriepavlovaWe're also on Tumblr: http://galeriepavlova.tumblr.com/
        
Many thanks for your interest in this project and we hope to see you at our opening!

story:
Our Story

About a month ago, I got a long awaited email response from the coordinators of the Adelaide Fringe Festival in Australia. The news? I had been accepted to cover the event. Not just any event. This was the Adelaide Fringe Festival, the second largest Fringe in the world, home to countless artistic acts, all vying for audience’s attention, for a chance to reveal their craft and their talent to the world. 

I couldn’t wait to help make that happen, through Infectious Magazine.

But since our inception nearly four years ago, and through the coverage of hundreds of local and national bands, we’ve always run on passion. Pure passion and heart. We run on the spark that comes from helping young, emerging artists of all kinds break into their industry. We’ve been lucky to cover many U.S. and U.K. based acts, but as so many artists know, this is not something you get into for the financial gain. And that’s why we need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We’ve launched this campaign solely to cover airfare costs (and maybe a few PBJ sandwiches along the way!). Luckily, we have a place to crash when we get there, but Australia is extremely expensive to get to from Boston, MA. We know that with your help we can make it happen, and bring artists one step closer to getting the public recognition they deserve through our website, our radio show which is currently on PoochFM (home of several shows by members the Margera family and co-run by CKY members) and throughout our social media and various partnerships.

For those who are able to donate to our campaign, we have some really unique, one time only rewards packages that are awesome for both fans AND bands. We have a great mix, including several prizes that come straight from the cause you’ll be helping make happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand money is tight (hey, that’s why we’re here!). So if you’re unable to donate, or even if you are, we ask that you please, please spread our message. Every tweet, every share, every “like” or post on Tumblr really helps our cause in not only covering Fringe Festival, but in helping us gain access to bands all around the world to share their story, and their music with you.

We thank you for your time and consideration. It means a lot, and we are grateful for your support.

story:
My name is Matt Gone. I am %99 tattooed in a checker pattern. I was tattooed to hide rare Birth Defects. I have only 1 Kidney and Kidney Disease. I use my tattoos to get media attention for medical issues.

I'm a spokesperson for Kidney Disease, and Poland's Syndrome. Poland's Syndrome is my rare Birth Defect. I have been the primary spokesperson for it for over 25 years. Most of the media about this very rare Birth Defect is directly because of my work in the media. Over 20,000 people have been diagnosed with Polands Syndrome because of me.. I am in medical textbooks due to my work. I teach doctors about this Birth Defect. I have helped thousands of lives and will continue as long as I can. That is why this fund raising.

I live in a small travel trailer, and would like to buy cheap land, and live off grid in Southern Oregon, or Northern California. my finances are very small, and this is my only defense against homelssness. To continue my medical treatment and stay alive. To put it simply, I have a Terminal Illness. 

All I want is to live off grid on my own land for my final years. I live in pain, and am partially disabled. My meidical condition will only get worse until I die. My dream of living on my own land is all that is left to keep me going. To have a very low cost way of living and enjoy the remaining year To complete this project.

 The budject is $20,000. That includes land, moving costs, water, and solar panels. I will live out there full time with my 2 cats. For you, the investor, you help a 25 year spokesperson for Disabled People continue his work, and keep a Terminally ill person from being homeless. You give a man who is dying young a last chance to live. That is all I can promise.

For a $10 investment, I will mail you a Matt Gone Postcard thanking you. I will mail it anywhere in the world. For $100, A postcard, and a t-shirt with my tattoos will be sent..

Please share this with as many people as you can. .

story:
Mission Statement

The Storyteller Guitar Project is redefining the relationship between musician and luthier.  Luthier Florian Vorreiter is undertaking extensive consultations with musicians Michael P Falk and Kerri Woelke - talking about family history, important personal events & the roots of their creativity.  And out of these stories he is designing an instrument that will tell their story in shape, acoustics, wood types and special features - several of which have never been attempted by a luthier before. 

The traditional demands of custom instruments must be met, including setup, voicing and model design. However, collaboration between the artists is allowing these instruments to grow beyond the average custom guitar build, and create instruments that stand alone as unique and meaningful works of art.  Integral design elements are being complemented by aesthetic and acoustic components that incorporate the the story and experiences of the musician into the guitar’s construction and design.

Florian wanted to undertake this project in the hopes that he could impact the creative lives of two working musicians and connect closer to the creative process and challenge the art of his craft.

They are also presenting a different approach to how musicians can afford instruments that are usually affordable only for a select few.  Most custom-built instruments are sold to guitar collectors & enthusiasts, hobbyists with professional income elsewhere, and every so often a musician who can scrape together the large fee for such an instrument.  

The trio are kicking off a crowd-funding IndieGoGo campaign with a concert & project exhibition at Florian’s store. More concerts to celebrate the project are in the planning stages.

 Artists

Kerri Stephens is a songwriter and a performer with Last Ditch On The Left as well as has 2 solo CD’s that have also been released under the name Kerri Woelke.  Her songwriting is very personal and varies between folk/roots and country. She has toured numerous times solo as well as with Last Ditch On The Left (w/ Brent Warren) ”Kerri (Stephens) has a voice on par with the best. I admire her passion.” - Michael Longoria (Percussionist – Patty Griffin)

Michael P Falk is a songwriter and performer with Les Jupes, the owner of Head In The Sand Records, a record producer, and former Artistic Director of the West End Cultural Centre.  His songwriting alternates between gentle acoustic ballads and driving indie rock, and his work to support and grow the local music community has had him dubbed “the patron-saint of the Winnipeg music scene” (Jaxon Haldane, d.Rangers)

Florian Vorreiter started his apprenticeship in Austria and continued his lutherie studies at university in Germany. After his graduation in 2008, he opened his own workshop in Winnipeg and a store last year. His instruments span a broad range of styles and types, but they are all characterized by his love for hand tools and traditional craftsmanship, a certain obsession with artistic detail and a relentless drive to fuse artistry with instrument making.

 

Thanks go out to:

This project is being realized with the friendly support of the Manitoba Arts Council.

story:
WOMEN’S RESIDENCY FOR TRANSMODERN AWARENESS 

WHAT

It is our goal to form an artist’s residency titled, Women’s Residency for Transmodern Awareness. The residency will take place during August of 2013 at Seneca State Forest, and intend to meditate on the theme of female collaboration and ritual in nature by use of the natural environment and formal workshops. The purpose of this curatorial artist residency is to create an available space for women artists to research how their work responds to a natural environment when removed from the constant stimulus of technology culture. The residency is catered to women (or anyone who identifies as so) in order to reflect on the female perspective in nature and as juxtaposed in contemporary art.

In the course of this residency, we will examine possibilities in which artists may utilize organic forms of nature and female collaboration in relation to contemporary art practice. Through transmodernism, the philosophical movement that seeks to reactivate a place for arcane in contemporary society, artists may embrace esoteric techniques of art making that simultaneously pertain to contemporary art. The artists will be encouraged to be transmodern in their approach, distinctly reacting to various forms of ritual used in cultural and spiritual traditions as well as their immediate surroundings in order to materialize a place of hermetic modernity through transcendental awareness.

WHY

Civilization and the advancement of technology have brought forth endless opportunities and information to promote the quality of life. However, at this period in history it is all the more urgent to sift through the static “noise” of television, internet, and electronic based information and realize the ability to use these available medias to the best of creative cognition. The most available way to realize this ability is to detach oneself from these medias and retreat to primitive nature in the place where art and spirituality were first born. Silence is used as an essential realization practice in a number of cultures around the world. In the heart of Zen Buddhism, there is a practice called, Zazen, in which one attempts to suspend all images, judgments, and distractions from their thought in order to gain the insight of silence and the nature of existence. Among Native American cultures there is a practice called, Vision Quest, which calls one to partake in a vocational journey to survive in the wilderness alone in order to understand their intended direction in life. The residency will be a space of reflection and absorption that offers the means of esoteric creation. By researching the effects of physical and figurative silence in a natural environment, we hope to discover how an artist’s experience and inspiration transforms their work in comparison to the antithesis, and to formulate a proposal in which one can utilize transmodernism to appropriate the balance of mystic and modernity in the creation of their artwork.

HOW

We will invite artists of every medium based on their merit and interest to live and work together within the natural grounds provided in Seneca State Forest for a period no longer than five days. The artists will direct and attend daily workshops, which will address how the meditation of will is used as a technique within different cultures and spiritualities while they work on a specific piece relative to the duration of the residency. The artwork created in collective will be presented for a group show in the Fall of 2013.

Artists who have created similar inspired works from which I have gained inspirations from include: The Center for the Advancement of Transmodern Awareness. C.A.T.A is an experimental artist’s space that serves as a venue for performances, lectures, workshops, free-school programming, and experiments. C.A.T.A’s mission is to manifest a transmodern reality through cultivating curiosity and self-awareness.

Workshops will take place during the residency to enrich the study of the effects that the rituals in nature impress on an artist’s work. An example of the first workshop will be the focus on the actualization of silence itself, in which the artists will be called together to perform a day of silence where they will work together abstaining from using vocal language as a tool for communication. The remaining workshops will be based on the observation of color, sound, spirit, and psyche in the natural surroundings, the influence of meditative and ritual practices used by several cultures and spiritualities, and field trips within the surrounding areas in order to build a strong community of artists to aid in the productions of artwork.

*Funds received for the residency will be used for transportation, materials, living and exhibition costs for the artists during their stay in Seneca State Forest. 

- Evana Roman 

*Video art by Inga Schunn

In collaboration with Breanne Merrit

story:
Hi there! My name is Ali Cat. Leeds. I am a printmaker currently living in Portland, Oregon. I received great news this past March that I have been accepted by Proyecto 'Ace, a non-profit artist residency in Buenos Aires, Argentina, to attend their SUB30 printmaking residency- a residency designed for artists under 30.

The Project:
___________________________________________________________________________
¡Historias de Resistencia!
I will be creating 2 or more relief prints illustrating different stories, myths, and/or histories of people's movements within Argentina. Argentina has a strong history of struggle, from the resistance to colonization, to the flow of radicals moving to Argentina from Spain and Italy during the fight against fascism and the fight for workers rights. In the more recent histories, there has been  the famous Madres de Plaza de Mayo, the piqueteros, the ecological fights against Monsanto and mining, and much more.

This will be my third time travelling to Argentina, but it will be my first time creating prints while there. I intend to spend about six months in Argentina to live, travel, learn, and work. Buenos Aires is the birthplace of my Grandfather, and Uruguay the birthplace of my Great Grandmother. I am passionate about learning of my family history and where I am from. Partaking in a printmaking residency in Argentina would allow me to create works that illustrate my new findings while being inspired by fellow artists and my surroundings.

For those who know my work, I have created multiple prints which go on to support different grass roots and non-profit organizations such as The Buffalo Field Campaign, Eric McDavid & Marie Mason's support funds, and the Earth First! Journal. One of the prints that I create at the residency will go on to support Portland Central American Solidarity Network.

What I need the funds for:
___________________________________________________________________________
The money I raise will go towards paying for the residency. The production residency is $2,320. This amount gives me access to the print studio, their press (large format electric press), and all the materials for printing including inks, proof paper, etc. along with technical advice. The rest of the money raised will go towards paying for my plane ticket there and back, (round-trip tickets to Argentina run between 1,200-1,500) as well as help with housing and other living expenses.

Other ways to help:
___________________________________________________________________________
If you are unable to contribute anything, don't worry. You can help me out a lot by sharing this and spreading the word!
Check out my website too: EntangledRoots.com for upcoming events and news as I get closer to leaving. My blog will be updated during my trip! I also have a store, where purchasing my work will also help me out getting to this residency. You can see my store HERE.

of radicals moving to Argentina from Spain and Italy during the fight
 against fascism and the fight for workers rights. In the more recent 
histories, there has been  the famous Madres de Plaza de Mayo, the piqueteros, the ecological fights against Monsanto and mining, and much more.This will be my third time travelling to Argentina, but it will be my first time creating prints while there. I intend to spend about six months in Argentina to live, travel, learn, and work. Buenos Aires is
the birthplace of my Grandfather, and Uruguay the birthplace of my
Great Grandmother. I am passionate about learning of my
family history and where I am from. Partaking in a printmaking
residency in Argentina would allow me to create works that
illustrate my new findings while being inspired by fellow artists and
my surroundings. For those who know my work, I have created multiple prints which go on to support different grass roots and non-profit organizations such as The Buffalo Field Campaign, Eric McDavid & Marie Mason's support funds, and the Earth First! Journal. One of the prints that I create at the residency will go on to support Portland Central American Solidarity Network.What I need the funds for:___________________________________________________________________________The money I raise will go towards paying for the residency. The production residency is $2,320. This amount gives me access to the print studio, their press (large format electric press), and all the materials for printing including inks, proof paper, etc. along with technical advice. The rest of the money raised will go towards paying for my plane ticket there and back, (round-trip tickets to Argentina run between 1,200-1,500) as well as help with housing and other living expenses.Other ways to help:___________________________________________________________________________If you are unable to contribute anything, don't worry. You can help me out a lot by sharing this and spreading the word! Check out my website too: EntangledRoots.com for upcoming events and news as I get closer to leaving. My blog will be updated during my trip! I also have a store, where purchasing my work will also help me out getting to this residency. You can see my store HERE.

story:
VISION SILKSCREEN PRINTS

We have already got the new silkscreen prints by MALLA studio



Lito-Grav black paper. 31x24 cms.
Metallic red ink
50 uds. signed and numered

Get yours now!





Gracias - Thanks - Merci - Danke - Graze - Dank - Cпасибо...


-

SOLO PARA BACKERS
PODÉIS PEDIR VUESTRA COPIA DEDICADA

¡Estamos contentos de poder anunciar que hemos llegado a la meta y VISION finalmente podrá ver la luz! Muchísimas gracias a todos los backers que habéis contribuido haciendo vuestros pedidos. Vamos a imprimir este proyecto que tanto nos ilusiona.
¡Pero, el hecho de haber llegado a la meta no quiere decir que no queden copias disponibles! Así, quien todavía no se haya hecho con el suyo aún está a tiempo de hacerlo. Además, os anunciamos que los backers van a poder recibir el libro con una dedicatoria personal escribiéndonos a velvetligavision@gmail.com indicando vuestro nombre o cualquier inscripción personal que os gustaría que llevase vuestro libro. ¡Si ya tienes una de las copias exclusivas de esta edición limitada de 333 copias ahora la recibirás dedicada!

¡Millones de gracias!


ONLY FOR BACKERS
ASK NOW FOR YOUR DEDICATED COPY

We are happy to tell you that we have reached our goal and VISION will finally come to life! Big thanks to all backers who have contributed by making their orders. We are starting with the printing of this project that encourages us so much.
But, the fact that we have reached the goal does not mean that there are no copies left! So whoever hasn’t got his copy already is still in time to order. Plus, we are happy to announce that the backers are going to be able to have a personal dedication on their book just by writing us at velvetligavision@gmail.com telling us your name or whatever personal inscription you want your book to have. So if you manage to get one of the limited edition 333 copies you will also receive it personally dedicated!
1 Million Thanks!

VISION “The black book of secrets and tricks” is a limited to 333 copies edition book. It runs through graffiti and the experiences of Dems333, who discovers himself in this book with the best kept secrets he has from the last 20 years.




VISION “The black book of secrets and tricks” es un libro de edición limitada a 333 copias. Se trata de un recorrido por el graffiti y las vivencias de Dems333, que se descubre en este libro desvelando algunos de los secretos mejor guardados de estos últimos 20 años.



                 


DEMS was born in Elche, Spain, in 1979. Since the early 90’s he met graffiti and started painting. More than 20 years in which he has never stopped inventing and developing styles, with a frenetic activity that has taken him to paint all around the world. There is no doubt that due to all this effort he has made his way into the international graffiti scenario. In VISION he will be leading the project that he has made and will bring it to life.

VELVET LIGA is a Spanish blog born 5 years ago and is nowadays a doubtless reference in the national and European scenario.

In Velvet Liga we simply love graffiti, tags, throw-ups, immense murals… We are interested in the new proposals the streets have, under any form or any label anyone wants to put on it. We like art, music, design, fashion, any creation that can cause emotion. We have been talking about each of these things since 2008 in a distended way, trying to be rigorous and maintaining our subjective opinion as a statement.

In this project we collaborate as producers, as in the elaboration of the texts with Alberto Martín.


                                                                 


DEMS nació en Elche, España en 1979. Desde principios de los 90 conoció el graffiti y empezó a pintar. Más de 20 años en los que no ha dejado de inventar y desarrollar estilos, con una actividad frenética que le ha llevado a pintar en medio mundo. No cabe duda de que gracias a todo este esfuerzo, se ha hecho con un hueco dentro del panorama internacional.

En VISION, se encargará de dirigir al equipo para que se haga realidad el proyecto que él mismo ha ideado.

VELVET LIGA es un blog español que nació hace 5 años y pronto se colocó como un referente indiscutible en el panorama nacional y europeo.

En Velvet Liga nos apasiona el graffiti, tags, throw-ups, los murales inmensos. Nos interesan las nuevas propuestas que se plantean en la calle, sea de la forma que sea y bajo la etiqueta que cada cual le quiera poner. Nos gusta el arte, la música, el diseño, la moda, cualquier creación que despierte en nosotros emoción. Llevamos hablando de todas estas cosas desde finales del 2008 de una manera distendida, procurando ser rigurosos, y manteniendo la máxima de la no objetividad.

En este proyecto colaboramos como productores y también en la elaboración de los textos, junto a Alberto Martín.



                       


VISION is presented in 160 pages in black and white with different quality materials in its paper, divided in 7 chapters, images and ideas, 7 “VISIONS” that the author Dems has wanted to show to us. It will be launched on a unique limited edition of 333 copies that the author will number and sign. Inside we will find a run through graffiti and the experiences that come along with it with a nice bunch of unpublished material. All of this turns this book into a collector’s exclusive piece.

We will also be able to enjoy the featuring of:

F.Pantone, Sozyone Gonzalez, Rosh333, Kiler, Daniel Muñoz “San”, Aigor, Sawe, KoolFunc´88...


VISION se presenta en 160 páginas en blanco y negro de distintas calidades, divididas en 7 capítulos, imágenes e ideas reflejadas en 7 ‘visiones’ que el propio Dems ha querido mostrarnos. Se lanzará una edición limitada a 333 copias que el autor numerará y firmará. En él podremos ver un recorrido por el graffiti y las vivencias que conlleva con una buena cantidad de material inédito. Todo ello hace de este libro una pieza exclusiva de coleccionista.

Además se podrá disfrutar de las colaboraciones entre otros de:

F.Pantone, Sozyone Gonzalez, Rosh333, Kiler, Daniel Muñoz “San”, Aigor, Sawe, KoolFunc´88...


                                             


                                              








       



                             


There has been hard work going on during the whole process of creation of VISION. We have undertaken this project attending fully on the quality of the final result, both on the content and the presentation. One of the most important decisions we made was launching VISION in a limited edition, to create something special other than a simple book.

Due to the small amount of copies and the quality of them, the cost of producing is higher than a normal book. We decided that the best way to produce is was through crowdfunding, generating this way a direct relationship between the creators and the customers.

Our goal using crowdfunding for this project is to print VISION and so it can come to life in a physical format, something the crew is excited about and is fond of achieving. We strongly believe that for the customer, this can be a really good opportunity to get hold of an exclusive and valuable piece.



THE COSTS




El proceso de gestación de Vision ha sido muy laborioso. Hemos emprendido este proyecto atendiendo principalmente a la calidad del resultado final, tanto por el contenido como por la presentación. Una de las decisiones más importantes que tomamos fue la de lanzar VISION en edición limitada a pocas copias, para así crear algo más especial que un simple libro. 

Debido a la poca cantidad de copias y al acabado seleccionado, el coste de producción es más elevado que el de un libro normal. Por ello decidimos que la mejor manera de producirlo era mediante un crowdfunding, generando así una relación directa entre creadores y compradores.

Nuestro objetivo a la hora de pedir apoyo en este proyecto es imprimir VISION y que vea la luz de manera física, algo que queremos que ocurra y que nos ilusiona al equipo que ha trabajado en ello. Creemos que para los compradores esta aportación puede ser una muy buena oportunidad para hacerse con una pieza exclusiva y valiosa



ARTWORKS


         


        

Last silkscreen prints by Leseditionspenibles. Paris



Spraypaint on canvas 90x200. Wearevoid Gallery. Amsterdam



Acrylic paint on preserved wood. 50x70x4. Wearevoid Gallery. Amsterdam



                             


We hope you like the project as much as we do and we can count you in for some support! On the other hand, if you like the project but you can't support us:

Spread the word!

Put a link to our project on your blog, website or whatever you can think of!We're thankful for every little bit of help we can getFeedback, questions, etc. please don’t doubt writing us:

velvetligavision@gmail.com


THANKS!!


-


Esperamos que os guste el proyecto tanto como nos gusta a nosotros y que podamos contar con vuestro apoyo. Y si no contáis con recursos y de todos modos queréis aportar vuestro granito de arena:

Haced que corra la voz!

Linkead el proyecto en vuestras páginas, blogs, o cualquier lugar que se os ocurra que pueda ser visto! ¡Estaremos muy agradecidos de cualquier pequeño gesto que nos ayude a llevar a cabo este proyecto! Para cualquier duda, feedback, etc. no dudéis en escribirnos:

velvetligavision@gmail.com


¡GRACIAS!

story:
About me

My name is Rick Alday.  I’m a freelance designer/photographer/coder.

I currently work as Support Manager at Graph Paper Press.  I’ve worked across a varied range of disciplines, from branding, motion graphics, photography and web design for the past 16 years.  I want to share my knowledge with young kids around the area who have no way to access art and design classes due to poverty and lack of proper resources and I need your help :)

About the project

The Beka Art Project will enable the area's most low-income youth to access quality out-of-school art education, while also exposing them to artistic and cultural experiences that enrich their lives — at absolutely no cost to them.

What kind of course will be offered?

We’ll star with 3 courses: Art, Graphic Design and Photography

Each course will be divided into submodules. 

1) Art (Drawing, Illustration, Murals, Printmaking, Collage, Painting)

2) Graphic Design (Color Theory, Composition, Layout, Typography, Design Software)

3) Photography (Camera basics, composition, lighting techniques)

Why art? Why free?

In an area where the average family income is $2,656 pesos (roughly 230 USD) school fees and education represent a hardship for most families.  After schools classes are simply out of the question and proper venues are practically non-existent.

Involvement in the arts is associated with gains in math, reading, cognitive ability, critical thinking, and verbal skill. Arts learning can also improve motivation, concentration, confidence, and teamwork. A 2005 report by the Rand Corporation about the visual arts argues that the intrinsic pleasures and stimulation of the art experience do more than sweeten an individual's life -- according to the report, they "can connect people more deeply to the world and open them to new ways of seeing," creating the foundation to forge social bonds and community cohesion.

Students will gain skills that will help them become better students, better citizens by developing a creative potential most of them don't know they have or have not had the opportunity to develop.

Why 30k?

We need decent computers, some digital cameras, software licenses, art supplies, furniture, etc.  We have been offered free studio space but it needs fixing and a few adaptations.

How else can you help?

You can start by sharing our Indiegogo campaign on your social networks.  If you have new or used art supplies, cameras, etc. that you want to donate please get in touch.  Everything helps.
