story:
DEBUT SHOW NEEDS YOUR HELP

 

Nuclear Nuqta

Nuclear: the nucleus of an atom, radiation of energy for power, possession of energy to destroy if weaponized or unstable

Nuqta: a diacritic mark used to denote characters and their pronunication in Arabic and derivative languages

 

The Reactor: what is Nuclear Nuqta?

Nuclear Nuqta is Muiz’s debut solo-exhibition in the United Kingdom. Leighton House will be hosting a selection of Muiz’s work, whose characteristic exploration of the Arab and Muslim identity and how they are informed by culture, language, geography and politics has become even more relevant in the post-911, revolutionary era.

By reclaiming, both visually and literally, language that has been redefined by political and media interests, Muiz seeks to provide a platform to re-examine the misconceptions and stereotypes that have fractured and provoked communities into conflict and what denotes their individual or collective identities.

This existential artistry is underpinned by his signature evolution of classical Islamic and Arabic art principles and philosophies into a striking, contemporary aesthetic. His work ultimately asks challenging questions of us exemplified by our reactions to the work; highlighting the potential [and importance] of a minority’s perception of truth to resonate and impact the majority.

“All art is political - because those that create art are governed by it.”

The Fusion: why fund a Nuclear art project?

"The medium is the message." | Marshal McLuhan

Art is a universal communication tool that trascends conventional language, and herein lies its power. It can do more than entice populations into investing in disposable, seasonal products. Art has the capacity to heal, educate and foster understanding between diverse communities who may have otherwise remained distant due to what is more often than not, lost in translation.

Art was crucially introduced to me as a form of visual communication. Having witnessed the global miscommunication and reinforcement of stereotypes of a faith, culture and community I am a part of, I found my role as a ‘visual communicator’ all the more relevant and significant. I have a role and responsibility to help initiate change and promote the voice of rationale to all parties involved.

By contributing toward Nuclear Nuqta, you will help communities regardless of their 'Eastern' or 'Western' background, discover and foster a new nucleus of understanding which can radiate worldwide.

 

The Fission: how funds help build a Nuqta

Funding the reactor to make sure my Nuqta go Nuclear, means I will be able to meet the generous quota of artwork Leighton House has made space for me to host. This will ensure that communities in London and across England will have the opportunity to discuss the range of themes my work explores, from Orientalism, the evolution of the Arabic language, terrorism, racism and much more.

 

If you're not into donations but love a bargain, it doesn't get much better than having the opportunity to own a piece of artwork many have admired worldwide, but few can claim to own.

$20 | £13

Limited to donators only, digital wallpaper of one of the artworks featured in the Nuclear Nuqta exhibition.

$50 | £33

There are 110 limited edition, full-colour prints of a never before seen 'calligram' I have created for a Palestinian city, as part of an as yet, undisclosed project.

$100 | £64

There are 55 limited edition, black and white prints of the campaign artwork I created for the Palestine Festival of Literature's 2012 Gaza debut [preview above] - each printed onto quality, luxurious paper stock.

For more information on perks, please check the column to the right.

 

The Scientist: al Majnun

Muiz is a visual communicator whose innovations in Arabic aesthetics have won him recognition by some of the world’s most iconic designers. His work evolves an experimental visual language born from the principles of classical Islamic art and philosophies which reflect the complex, cultural semiotics and geopolitics of the modern Arab world.

Muiz is currently developing two ground-breaking bi-lingual typefaces scheduled for exclusive licensing with the most esteemed type foundries in the world, Dalton Maag of London and FontShop International of Berlin.

He recently art directed and designed the Arabic and English editions of the critically acclaimed, Reflections on Islamic Art – which collects the writings of 27 of the world's leading poets, mathematicians, scientists, philosophers – for the Museum of Islamic Art in Doha, published worldwide by Bloomsbury and Bloomsbury Qatar. His approach to bi-lingual publication design has been regarded as exemplary by Huda Smitshuijzen Abifarès of the Khatt Foundation and others, particularly the delicate balance of Arabic and Latin aesthetics and a respect for traditional Middle-Eastern, philosophical traditions.

Muiz has also launched a critically acclaimed magazine, branded national and international arts organisations and festivals and been recognised in digital and print journals across the globe. He currently works as art director for the internationally renowned Palestine Festival of Literature and is developing programmes to help foster creative talent, academically and professionally, from occupied Palestine.
 
 

Lab coat & goggles? Check.

Nuclear Nuqta is just the nucleus of an idea -you can help its memorandum of understanding through visuals, radiate out far and wide. Post, tweet and donate.
 

Sign here...

Leighton House Museum
12 Holland Park Road
Kensington
W14 8LZ

...here...

3-26 October
Open 10am-5.30pm daily
Closed Tuesdays

...and here.

 
Nuclear Nuqta exhibition (Free)
Full details of admission charges to the Leighton Museum are available online:
w: www.leightonhouse.co.uk

story:
Let your life be your masterpiece...

Hi! My name is Claire Reynes and papermaking is my passion. I started Zenith Art Studio so I could share my love of handmade paper with my community, friends and fellow artists.  Papermaking is such a unique medium because it can be both craft and fine art.  You will always succeed at making paper, whether you want to make plain white sheets to write thank you notes on later to creating a 2' x 4' colorful, swirling masterpiece with flowers embedded in the piece!  Paper can be sculptural with wire armatures or casted in a clay mold, it can be utilitarian as a paper lamp or bound in a journal, it can be huge or tiny, rough or smooth...  Papermaking is for EVERYONE.

I have worked with so many different kinds of people - different ages, backgrounds, life experiences, goals...  Over the summer we had workshops for West Suburban Special Recreation Association where we made paper in a Nepalese style and explored the sensory aspect of papermaking and played with color and texture. We hosted the EcoRangers, summer day campers from the Oak Park Conservatory, in the studio for a couple days and talked about what it means to upcycle and how making paper from recycled t-shirts or from plant waste is a great way to do that!  We had a workshop at Maize Library in Oak Park with 50 years of age between our youngest and oldest participants!  I also was able to teach papermaking at the Puerto Rican Cultural Center for their After School Matters program and am getting ready for another after-school program at Longfellow Elementary in Oak Park, IL. 

Papermaking has allowed me to work with all these different kinds of people and I feel so grateful for that.  I want to learn from and with others and to hopefully give them something in return, something that will resonate with them for the rest of their lives.  Even if they only make paper once, I hope that it is an experience that they never forget.  Zenith is really about creating an experience, not necessarily a masterpiece.  Let your life be your masterpiece.   

What We Need & What You Get

Zenith Art Studio needs to purchase some equipment to complete our professional  papermaking offerings. We still need a permanent paper beater, which is the main piece of equipment in a paper studio.  It allows us to transform old t-shirts and jeans, and also plant material into pulp that is then turned into paper.  We will give people access to the equipment, space, and supplies that are often only available in colleges or university type settings. By providing greater access we hope to enable people to create amazing things that otherwise would be out of their reach.

Equipment to purchase:

professional papermaking mold and deckles (varying sizes and styles)

storage units for renters and studio users

bolt of pellon

vats and stainless steel vat table

paper beater

stock cotton rag and abaca fibers

screenprinting mesh and photo emulsion for creating pulp imaging stencils

Epson printer

Bookbinding supplies for classes (japanese screw punch, nipping press, etc.)

Zenith sign!!!!


We also realize most people don’t know much about the papermaking process or that papermaking can be an art form. We plan to use some of the money to let our town know we are here and what we are all about. What good is a community art studio if people don’t know your around.

Zenith will be a space that centers around community engagement and collaboration.  We want to open our doors to the community   In addition to one of the amazing perks you get for donating you will forever be one of our heroes!

PERKS

Check out the gallery for more PERK PICTURES!!! If you are giving your perk to someone for the holidays this year let us know!! We can ship some of these items to you this week (excluding stickers, tshirts, sweatshirts)

Sacred Geometry large pulp painting


    The Impact

    Zenith Art Studio offers workshops for beginners to experienced paper-makers. We offer classes on topics like, marbling paper, making paper from clothing fibers like t-shirts and  blue jeans, painting with paper pulp, creating watermarks in paper, and so much more!  We love sharing the possibilities of handmade paper with our neighbors  in a supportive, educational, and fun environment.

    Zenith is establishing itself as a co-op art studio that provides a space for artists and non-artists to learn, explore, and collaborate using handmade paper and other media.  We also look for ways to partner with other community organizations, providing papermaking workshops on-location or in the studio.  So far, we've had the pleasure of working with the Oak Park Conservatory, Longfellow Elementary, The Oak Park Library, and WSSRA and look forward to more opportunities to collaborate with these groups and many more in the area.


      Other Ways You Can Help

       Can't donate right now?  That's okay!  It'd help us out a lot if you could spread the word about Zenith and our campaign!  Like us on Facebook and please share our Indiegogo link with friends and family.  Also, come by the studio sometime!  We want to get to know our community better and the people in it.  We want to hear what you think our community needs and your ideas on how Zenith can contribute.  If you have a project in mind but you're not sure how to make it happen, email us!! We want to collaborate with you!!!

story:
hybris.théâtre / théâtre de recherche / théâtre de résistance

Fondé en 2010 par de jeunes finissants des écoles de théâtre, hybris.théâtre s'attache depuis à créer un théâtre surprenant, innovateur, politique.

hybris

mouvement fautif du dépassement de la limite / démesure, courage, orgueil du héros grec qui persévère dans sa quête / action entreprise malgré les obstacles, en dépit des avertissements 

rechercher

travailler à l’intersection de la théorie et de la pratique / développer une esthétique sans compromis / privilégier une démarche intellectuelle et interdisciplinaire / créer un théâtre performatif / déconstruire le dire par une attention particulière au travail du rythme

résister

mettre de l’avant une esthétique du refus / aborder le théâtre comme un engin de pouvoir à déconstruire / présenter des corporalités fortes et intransigeantes /affirmer une politique de la subversion /repenser le genre à travers les théories et pratiques queer

 

notre campagne

Cette campagne vise à lever des fonds pour notre prochaine création, ORPHÉE REVOLVER, qui sera présentée du 8 au 17 novembre 2012 au Théâtre Ste-Catherine (Montréal).

ORPHÉE REVOLVER représente deux ans de travail continu pour l'équipe de hybris.théâtre, depuis la création en août 2010 jusqu'à la présente reprise. Deux ans de réécriture, de re-création, de remises en question.

Sur la barre latérale, vous verrez les avantages liés à chacun des paliers de contribution. 

Votre soutien permettra à l'équipe de ORPHÉE REVOLVER de réaliser un spectacle à la hauteur du travail accompli. Les fonds rassemblés permettront de couvrir les dépenses liées à la production ainsi qu'à la rémunération des jeunes artistes participants.

 

ORPHÉE REVOLVER

Orphée

un personnage mythique / un grand poète / un des piliers de la culture occidentale/

Eurydice

une femme en détresse / une possession perdue qu’il faut récupérer à tout prix

Avec ORPHÉE REVOLVER, hybris.théâtre investit le mythe d’Orphée afin de faire entendre la voix d’Eurydice. Une voix forte, singulière, voire violente. Une voix de femme. Un spectacle qui sonne comme un coup de fusil, des textes qui tournent au rythme du barillet. ORPHÉE REVOLVER, c’est tout à la fois un problème mathématique, une conférence sur la féminité, une réécriture d’un mythe, une plongée dans la culture pop. Et, en plein dans le viseur du tireur d’élite, trois Eurydices, trois possibilités pour une héroïne contemporaine. Un spectacle dangereux, parce qu’à la roulette russe, on ne gagne pas toujours.

Peu après son mariage avec le grand poète Orphée, la nymphe Eurydice est mordue par un serpent et meurt. Son mari, follement amoureux (ou désespérément possessif) séduira tout un chacun avec sa lyre afin de ramener sa femme chez les vivants. Mais qu’en est-il d’Eurydice? Et si elle ne voulait pas revenir des Enfers? Qu’arriverait-t-il si elle avait une volonté propre? Si on lui donnait une voix afin qu’elle puisse tout dire, afin qu’elle puisse crier sa rage à la face du monde, pourrait-on soutenir son discours?

Réécriture du mythe d’Orphée, ORPHÉE REVOLVER est une véritable plongée dans le genre, soutenue par une matière textuelle composite. Grand art, culture pop, écrits théoriques, calculs mathématiques, mais aussi artistes, prostituées, meurtrières…. sont tous conviés à la remontée d’Eurydice vers la terre ferme.

Équipe de la production

mise en scène. Philippe Dumaine

assistance à la mise en scène + régie. Sophie Devirieux

décors + éclairages. Andréane Bernard

stylisme. Philippe Dumaine

musique live. Mykalle Bielinski

avec.

Mylène Bergeron, Mykalle Bielinski, Luc Chandonnet, Marie-Ève de Courcy, Danièle Simon

 

d'autres façons de nous aider...

Il vous est possible d'aider à faire de cette campagne un succès en la partageant dans vos réseaux. La réussite de notre levée de fonds est profondément liée à sa diffusion maximale.

Vous pouvez aussi visiter le site web, la page facebook et le twitter de hybris.théâtre afin d'être tenus au courant des autres activités entourant la production de ORPHÉE REVOLVER.
story_txt:
hybris.théâtre / théâtre de recherche / théâtre de résistance

Fondé en 2010 par de jeunes finissants des écoles de théâtre, hybris.théâtre s'attache depuis à créer un théâtre surprenant, innovateur, politique.
hybris
mouvement fautif du dépassement de la limite / démesure, courage, orgueil du héros grec qui persévère dans sa quête / action entreprise malgré les obstacles, en dépit des avertissements 
rechercher
travailler à l’intersection de la théorie et de la pratique / développer une esthétique sans compromis / privilégier une démarche intellectuelle et interdisciplinaire / créer un théâtre performatif / déconstruire le dire par une attention particulière au travail du rythme
résister
mettre de l’avant une esthétique du refus / aborder le théâtre comme un engin de pouvoir à déconstruire / présenter des corporalités fortes et intransigeantes /affirmer une politique de la subversion /repenser le genre à travers les théories et pratiques queer
 
notre campagne
Cette campagne vise à lever des fonds pour notre prochaine création, ORPHÉE REVOLVER, qui sera présentée du 8 au 17 novembre 2012 au Théâtre Ste-Catherine (Montréal).
ORPHÉE REVOLVER représente deux ans de travail continu pour l'équipe de hybris.théâtre, depuis la création en août 2010 jusqu'à la présente reprise. Deux ans de réécriture, de re-création, de remises en question.
Sur la barre latérale, vous verrez les avantages liés à chacun des paliers de contribution. 
Votre soutien permettra à l'équipe de ORPHÉE REVOLVER de réaliser un spectacle à la hauteur du travail accompli. Les fonds rassemblés permettront de couvrir les dépenses liées à la production ainsi qu'à la rémunération des jeunes artistes participants.
 
ORPHÉE REVOLVER
Orphée
un personnage mythique / un grand poète / un des piliers de la culture occidentale/
Eurydice
une femme en détresse / une possession perdue qu’il faut récupérer à tout prix
Avec ORPHÉE REVOLVER, hybris.théâtre investit le mythe d’Orphée afin de faire entendre la voix d’Eurydice. Une voix forte, singulière, voire violente. Une voix de femme. Un spectacle qui sonne comme un coup de fusil, des textes qui tournent au rythme du barillet. ORPHÉE REVOLVER, c’est tout à la fois un problème mathématique, une conférence sur la féminité, une réécriture d’un mythe, une plongée dans la culture pop. Et, en plein dans le viseur du tireur d’élite, trois Eurydices, trois possibilités pour une héroïne contemporaine. Un spectacle dangereux, parce qu’à la roulette russe, on ne gagne pas toujours.
Peu après son mariage avec le grand poète Orphée, la nymphe Eurydice est mordue par un serpent et meurt. Son mari, follement amoureux (ou désespérément possessif) séduira tout un chacun avec sa lyre afin de ramener sa femme chez les vivants. Mais qu’en est-il d’Eurydice? Et si elle ne voulait pas revenir des Enfers? Qu’arriverait-t-il si elle avait une volonté propre? Si on lui donnait une voix afin qu’elle puisse tout dire, afin qu’elle puisse crier sa rage à la face du monde, pourrait-on soutenir son discours?
Réécriture du mythe d’Orphée, ORPHÉE REVOLVER est une véritable plongée dans le genre, soutenue par une matière textuelle composite. Grand art, culture pop, écrits théoriques, calculs mathématiques, mais aussi artistes, prostituées, meurtrières…. sont tous conviés à la remontée d’Eurydice vers la terre ferme.
Équipe de la production
mise en scène. Philippe Dumaine
assistance à la mise en scène + régie. Sophie Devirieux
décors + éclairages. Andréane Bernard
stylisme. Philippe Dumaine
musique live. Mykalle Bielinski
avec.
Mylène Bergeron, Mykalle Bielinski, Luc Chandonnet, Marie-Ève de Courcy, Danièle Simon


 
d'autres façons de nous aider...
Il vous est possible d'aider à faire de cette campagne un succès en la partageant dans vos réseaux. La réussite de notre levée de fonds est profondément liée à sa diffusion maximale.
Vous pouvez aussi visiter le site web, la page facebook et le twitter de hybris.théâtre afin d'être tenus au courant des autres activités entourant la production de ORPHÉE REVOLVER.

story:
SandDance is a big art installation of a Phoenix on the Playa of MidBurn- the official regional event organized by the MidBurn community- the Israeli Burning Man community.

More about MidBurn: midburn.org

SandDance is a bold display of art, vision, and skilled workmanship.

The installation presents the legendary Phoenix's life cycle: A 9 meter high wooden bird, which will be burned at MidBurn, and a huge metal egg, as the bird regenerates itself.

The Phoenix will rise at the MidBurn: Transcendence event, and we invite you to join its journey- grow and be reborn from the fire.

With your kind donation the Phoenix will spread its wings and fly.


Us and the project:

We are a small group of burners, gathered for this vision- to bring a retelling of the mythical desert bird's legend, to the sandy grounds of the Playa.

At this time, the inner structure of the bird is being constructed, and the 62 flame/feathers are being cut out of plywood boards by a team of engineers, designer carpenters, and other artists and craftsmen who volunteer their time and resources. Also being constructed is a 2 meter high iron egg that will nestle inside the Phoenix and will glow bright red as the bird burns.


You can help!

We are hoping to raise $7000 overall to bring this bird to life. So far we have already raised enough funds to buy most of the wood beams, plywood boards, screws and nails needed to get construction started, we have reached the 50% mark. We still need to buy more construction materials and lighting, and pay to transport this beast to the Playa... We now need your help to complete the project and inject fire into our dreams.

Donors will become members of the Order of The Phoenix and will receive our awesome perks. To every perk which includes shipping, we will also try to add a surprise- the SandDance gifting perk we make for burners on the Playa.

Friends who can't contribute can still be a great help, get the word out and let other people know about this campaign! Share it and follow our progress on Facebook.

We want to thank each and every one of you for contributing your time, resources and donations to make this dream a reality, we couldn't do this without you. We truly hope to see you all out on the Playa, dancing around the Phoenix as we let go and transcend.

story:
About Unawatuna

I first built a relationship with the Unawatuna community in 2005 after the tsunami. With my college student organization, we started the Sri Lanka Art Project, where we taught art to children orphaned by the tsunami. Art was approached as a form of expression and communication among children who had survived the disaster. This project became a study abroad program at The New School University for four years.

The community of Unawatuna is still rebuilding, even eight years after the disaster. Thilak Welagama, the owner of Zimmer Rest guest house in Unawatuna, and our host in 2005-2008, has continued to spearhead community projects in the Unawatuna area, especially with local schools. 

In the grounds of Amarasingharamaya Buddhist temple, is Sri Rathanasara preschool, where local children learn and play. Their playground is in need of cleanup and repair. Additionally, the interior of the building is in need of a paint job.  

What We Need 

ALL money earned goes directly to this project and the school. We will be purchasing the following: 

  • Paint
  • Painting supplies
  • Cleaning supplies

Additionally, 14 people have paid their own way to spend 4 days completing the labor to enhance this school. If we do not meet the goal through IndieGoGo, Daisy Yoga LLC will supplement the remaining cost of the project. Any money over our goal will go towards books and school supplies for the children.

Those who donate $100 or more will receive a cute wooden elephant statue from Sri Lanka as a token of our gratitude.

The Impact

Sri Rathanasara Buddhist temple is an important part of the Unawatuna community. Young children begin their education at this preschool. By repairing and painting the playground and interior, the temple school will be a nicer place to learn!

story:
About Me

I am currently a third year graduate student in painting and drawing at the University of Florida. Throughout graduate school I have made work dealing with grief and loss, specifically focused on mourning people who have already passed away. Memories erode. People pass away. Loss and death are common human experiences, and as we age, we are all confronted by the deaths of those around us, as well as by our own mortality. While some accept these experiences as a part of life, many people—including myself—struggle with these inevitabilities on a daily basis.

My new work focuses on dealing with my parents’ mortality and preparing for their future deaths. They pose as corpses in isolated natural settings, and I then cover their photographed images with hand-drawn shrouds of flowers. The ritualized process of burial and ceremony helps lend order to the often overwhelming experience of death. I use the ritualized process of drawing—the slow, meticulous use of repeated marks and forms—to help me come to terms with their eventual deaths.

What I Need & What You Get

Creating this work requires a high-end, high megapixel camera so I can make large photographic prints (7 feet by 10 feet), as well as a couple rolls of high quality paper to make the prints on. I will also need lots of little things like new gouache, watercolor, brushes, etc. Any contributed money will help me pay for these items, making my thesis project possible!

$4,000 will help pay for these materials. Any money above and beyond will help me buy other items, such as extra paper, digital editing programs, and other art supplies.

For donation perks, I am offering letterpress cards, digital prints of my art, as well as original works of art. Images of perks can be seen below.

Impact

100 years ago most deaths took place at home. In America today, most deaths take place in institutions, such as hospitals or nursing homes. Morticians are largely in charge of dealing with dead bodies leading to a gradual removal from interacting with death and the dead.  Death is often an avoided subject, a gaping chasm at the end of each of our lives around which we tiptoe, but birth and death are the two human experiences which we all share. To die is to be human.

Through my work, I deal with my own fears surrounding death. However, I also hope to bring death back into conversation. Often when people find out my work is about death and loss, their first question is "are you ok?" Inferring that because I am thinking about death that I must be depressed. Death is scary. It does make me sad, but it is also a huge part of life. I think talking about death makes it less scary. I think dealing with this eventuality through ritual, through ceremony, and through community rather than as individuals also makes it less scary. Lastly, death is beautiful. Without death there wouldn't be room for new life.

Other Ways to Help

I know some people can’t afford to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and share this campaign.
  • Talk about death with someone you love

Lastly, any and all contributions are greatly appreciated. Thank you so much!

$10 Perk - Set of 2 Letterpress Postcards

$20 Perk - Combo Set of Cards

$35 Perk - 5" x 7" Digital Print. Choice of images below.

story:
Hello!

Hi! I'm Alex Lavelle. I'm a freelance theatre director, based out of Chicago, with a degree in Directing from Columbia College Chicago.

I'm directing and producing KITTY KITTY KITTY by Noah Haidle at Hydrate Nightclub. My first independent production ever! 

My team and I need your help to do this. Your support will literally make this project a come to life. We just finished our first week of rehearsal and need your support to continue moving forward.

What We Need & What You Get

We need money to cover the rights for the show, $640.
The cost of production, approximately $300, which will cover costumes, props, and set (we're doing it on the cheap).
We also need to cover two $150 stipends for our designers and another $60 for graphics. 
Total = $1,300


Some perks we're offering to our donors include weekly email updates about the show, photos of the production, as well as mention in our programs and on our Facebook thank you video!
If we don't reach our entire goal, funds will go directly to covering the rights. Any left over will distributed equally among the design team who, so far, have been donating their amazing services. Any funds that don't get generated will need to be eliminated equalling a less fabulous but hopefully still functional show. 

The Impact

Your contribution will impact our show tremendously:

  • We're trying to shape the culture of our community and the world by broadening its exposure to the arts.
  • While at school, I was fortunate enough to have contributed to dozens of successful productions. Since graduating I've been fortunate enough to work on several more award-winning productions throughout the city as an assistant director.The combined total of my experience along with the cast and design team equals hundreds of beautiful shows. We know what we're doing and we're ready to take this next step. 
  • Your support is all we need to complete this project and begin making a positive impact on our society by way of art.

Risks & Challenges

  • We've already begun rehearsals. We're struggling to find rehearsal space for nights when Hydrate is unavailable. We're balancing our work schedules against rehearsals, we have no real budget, and we're understaffed.
  • We're all working so hard to make this happen. We've put our heads together and begun drafting tons of ideas, along with plan b's and plan c's. We're hosting a benefit to raise additional funds and support our needs. We're reaching out to local business, friends and family for support. We're all very committed to making this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

We get that money doesn't grow on trees. Trust me.
  • If you can't contribute monetarily, spread the word on the show! Tell others about what we're trying to do, share the links, or simply mention us to someone. We appreciate any and everything you can do to help us! 

Thank you for taking the time to read this!

story:
please support twigin - start conversations

i want to connect the world. too many people are lonely and inactive. just next door or passing you on the street there might be someone your age who you share tons of activities and hobbies with.
 
twigin.de allows for just the right mix of sharing enough to connect and at the same time not giving away too much personal information - the icons are fun and the shared activities not too private.
 
collect your twigs online at www.twigin.de or wear them offline on buttons/t-shirts and show people how to start a conversation and possibly a friendship with you.

check it out - it's free

create your free profile at www.twigin.de
 
(for the English version click on the bottom right button on the page)

how you can help

i have already invested a lot of time and money of my own, but to make twigin public, to build in new features such as the "twig of the month" and to create a mobile app for iphone and android so you can get to know people on the street or on a bus or in a café with your mobile device, i need help. money and support.

no money? spread the word :)

i appreciate help in any way. advice on how to make the tool even better or just a friendly email.
 
if you want to tell your friends about twigin, that would help a lot. maybe create your own community in your town. as in any community, the more people join, the more fun twigin will be.
story_txt:
please support twigin - start conversations
i want to connect the world. too many people are lonely and inactive. just next door or passing you on the street there might be someone your age who you share tons of activities and hobbies with.
 
twigin.de allows for just the right mix of sharing enough to connect and at the same time not giving away too much personal information - the icons are fun and the shared activities not too private.
 
collect your twigs online at www.twigin.de or wear them offline on buttons/t-shirts and show people how to start a conversation and possibly a friendship with you.

check it out - it's free
create your free profile at www.twigin.de

story:
My Story

A friend suggested I try this campaign as a way of getting some support with my art exhibition. I am home-bound most of the time due to multiple chronic illnesses. I started painting in 2006 and I never imagined that it would be so uplifting! I also never imagined that I would get the chance to exhibit my work.  i haven't studied art, i've just fallen into it... and now the opportunity has come up to exhibit 45 - 50 of my paintings!!!  as part of a joint show : POW Childrens' Hospital Xmas Art Exhibitions Opening 8th Dec at 5:30pm - 8:30pm at Big Pond Cafe Level 0, (High Street entrance), Randwick, Sydney. Artworks on 4 levels on show until 27th Jan 2012).


I will be showcasing a selection of my abstract paintings at this event. I'm in the process of getting things framed and ready for hanging.


**Update: 15th Nov 2011**

Everything is on track and i'm gettin really excited about opening day. I still need help with the costs of framing and thanks to contributions thus far... i'm getting closer to the goal!  Your donations will not only help me, you'll also be supporting the Sydney Children's Hospital Foundation. (25% of my sales/proceeds goes to SCH Foundation). I'm looking forward to adding some colour to the hallways of Level 3, and hopefully the sick kiddies and their families will like it too : )


for a preview of my paintings go here:
http://nebulart.redbubble.com


Hope to see you there, if you're in sydney... your support is greatly appreciated.

Cheers Sammi xxx

What I Need & What You Get

I will need around $2000 to pay for quality frames. I have someone working on the frames (a lovely and generous soul) and I'm endeavoring to pay installments on the work, but its slow going on the pension! Every person who contributes will receive one of my original hand painted (frame-able) greeting cards. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help my campaign by sharing/linking this article with your friends or anyone you feel may be interested in helping out.  My aim is to sell enough work at the exhibition to fix my car! Many thanks : )

story:
Our Story

On December 31, 2010, state and federal correctional authorities had jurisdiction over 1,605,127 prisoners. It is no surprise that there are many talented artists who are away from home. Prodigious Penn is a gallery for inmate art. Ours is simply an effort to bridge gaps, provide a positive outlet and bring such talent to light. We have been in contact with artists across the country from Comstock, New York to Crescent City, California. All of the responses have been positive; this has translated into an overwhelming desire by the artists to create, share and expand personal horizons. Many of the artists' basic necessities may not be provided by the institutions in which they are housed. We are Prodigious Penn. Our artists receive the majority of the proceeds from anything we put into the hands of private collectors. In an effort to remain impartial, we only display the art, the artist's name and the media used to create the art. Our artists have to be resourceful and creative. The artists want to spend time bettering themselves in a productive manner and we intend to help.

The Impact

There are several positive outcomes for our artists. Some have families who they would like to help financially. Many require basic necessities, such as clothing, toiletries, and believe it or not, food which may not be provided by the facility in which they are housed. Some artists are building a portfolio they can access upon their release and intend to make a career utilizing their artistic abilities. Our artists see it as an opportunity to further their talents and share with art enthusiasts in the outside world. Some simply see it as a productive way to spend their time.

What We Need & What You Get

Our artists could use help with art supplies, postage and books, publications, etc., in order to fuel their creativity, expand their artistic horizons and reinforce their positive outlooks. Prodigious Penn could use help to fund web-hosting, purchase postage to keep in contact with artists, pay for vendor space fees and to purchase display items such as tables, frames and matting for public display. A musician style flight case is needed for art in order to keep it in its original condition, fabric and lights are needed for the display. Promotional materials such as posters, flyers and business cards are imperative in order to gain as much exposure as possible for our artists. If our goal is not reached, any proceeds collected will go directly to these needs. Those who have donated still receive perks in relation to the amount donated as well as a warm and fuzzy feeling knowing that you helped those who wish to help themselves in a productive manner.

Other Ways You Can Help

Make some noise about our campaign! Tell your Facebook, Twitter or other social network friends about us and direct them to our website and IndieGoGo campaign pages. Talk about us at work, church, school, on the bus or wherever you strike up a conversation. Start a conversation with "I just saw this thing on the internet called Prodigious Pennâ€¦" and see where it goes from there!

Visit our website: www.ProdigiousPenn.com and see for yourself. If you know anybody who is in the same position as our artists, get in touch with them and tell them about us. They'll be happy to hear from you and we'd appreciate you passing along our story. We could use any help you're willing to give so thank you very much for spreading the word!

story:
Since 1993, the Southern Fried Poetry Slam (SFPS) has electrified audiences all throughout the region and provided a positive atmosphere for poets to congregate, network and share their individual talents. Shifting annually between the 13 states in the southeastern region, SFPS has become a staple of the south and Slam poetry nationwide.

First hosted in Asheville, NC this regional competition has been the traveling home of a southern arts revolution. Known for its dynamic creative edge, the Southern Fried Poetry Slam has continued to revolutionize the genre. Originally, because the event was on the very fringes, the winning team and individual received only RC Cola and Moonpies. Over the course of 19 years the cash prizes have risen to $7500…and RC Colas and Moonpies!

From June 6-9, 2012, the torch will be passed to Tampa, Fl.

Hosting 24 teams from all over the South (and beyond), the 2012 Southern Fried Poetry Slam will be a beacon of light and change in a rapidly evolving world. Poets at the top of their form will don their timeless regalia and enrich the spirits of all who are present. Over the course of three days, over one hundred poets will compete at several venues in Ybor City, sometimes concurrently.

This year Philadelphia will be sending a team. Said, team is unique due to 

A) its unprecedented amount of talent and performance experience. 

B) It will also, mark the first time an all women of color, Queer team will compete in the history of Southern Fried.

We are now calling on the very community we represent proudly, for assistance on this journey.  

On June 5th we will embark on a 17hour drive from Philadelphia to Florida. 
Below is a break down of the projected  cost.

Our fund raising goal is: $1,000.00 

Thank you in advance for supporting those who have supported your events, organization and or gatherings. 

          -Sincerely 215th
